00022 /**
00023  * @file   GcAdjust.h
00024  * @author Chuck Sugnet
00025  * @date   Mon Oct 24 09:42:02 2005
00026  * 
00027  * @brief Class for doing an adjustment based on the median intensity of probes
00028  * with similar GC content.
00029  */
00030 #ifndef _GCADJUST_H_
00031 #define _GCADJUST_H_
00032 
00033 //
00034 #include "chipstream/ChipLayout.h"
00035 #include "chipstream/PmAdjuster.h"
00036 #include "chipstream/QuantMethod.h"
00037 //
00038 #include "stats/stats.h"
00039 #include "util/Verbose.h"
00040 //
00041 #include <map>
00042 #include <vector>
00043 //
00044 
00045 /// String describing gc adjust algorithm/module
00046 #define GCADJUSTSTR "pm-gcbg"
00047 
00048 /**
00049  *  Class for doing an adjustment based on the median intensity of probes
00050  * with similar GC content.
00051  */
00052 class GcAdjust : public PmAdjuster {
00053 
00054 public:
00055 
00056   /** Constructor. */
00057   GcAdjust(int maxGc=26) : m_MaxGc(maxGc), m_BinsFilled(false) {
00058     setDocName(GCADJUSTSTR);
00059     setDocDescription("Do an adjustment based on the median intensity of probes with similar GC content.");
00060     m_Type = getDocName();
00061     setDocOptions(getDefaultDocOptions());
00062   }
00063 
00064   /** 
00065    * @brief Constructor taking information about both the chip and
00066    * probes to be used for estimating parameters.
00067    * 
00068    * @param layout - Annotation of probes on microarray.
00069    * @param controlProbes - Probes to be used for estimating parameters.
00070    */
00071   void setLayout(ChipLayout &layout, vector<Probe *> &controlProbes);
00072 
00073   /** 
00074    * @brief Constructor taking information about both the chip and
00075    * probes to be used for estimating parameters.
00076    * 
00077    * @param board - Blackboard containing lots of state.
00078    */
00079   void setParameters(PsBoard &board);
00080   
00081   /** 
00082    * @brief Set the probes necessary for estimating GC background to
00083    * true so they will be loaded.
00084    * 
00085    * @param probes - bitmask for probe to be loaded.
00086    */
00087   void setProbes(vector<bool> &probes);
00088 
00089   /** 
00090    * How many probes are in the background list?
00091    * @return - number of probes being used for background.
00092    */
00093   uint32_t getBgProbeCount() {
00094     return (uint32_t) m_Probes.size();
00095   }
00096 
00097   /** 
00098    * @brief Fill in the GC bins using the raw data in intensity mart
00099    * and processed by iTrans ChipStream.
00100    * 
00101    * @param chipIx - Index of chip to be filled in.
00102    * @param iMart - Raw data to be used.
00103    * @param iTrans - Chipstreams that will be used to transform the raw data.
00104    */
00105   void fillChipBins(int chipIx, const IntensityMart &iMart, std::vector<ChipStream *> &iTrans);
00106 
00107   /** 
00108    * @brief Calculate the parameters for each GC count.
00109    * 
00110    * @param iMart - Raw data from chips.
00111    * @param iTrans - Transformations to apply to data.
00112    */
00113   void calcParams(const IntensityMart &iMart, std::vector<ChipStream *> &iTrans);
00114 
00115 
00116   /** 
00117    * @brief For probe supplied look up the median of background probes with
00118    * same GC nucleotide count.
00119    * @param probeIx - Index of probe in cel file data.
00120    * @param chipIx - Microarray or chip index.
00121    * @param iMart - IntensityMart which holds raw data.
00122    * @param iTrans - Vector of transformations that should be performed on raw data.
00123    * @param pmIintensity - Intensity of perfect match probe to be adjusted, may
00124    * be modified from original value depending on adjuster
00125    * @param bgrdAdjust - Background adjustment, if any, recommended (i.e. MM intensity)
00126    */
00127   void pmAdjustment(int probeIx, int chipIx, 
00128                     const IntensityMart &iMart, std::vector<ChipStream *> &iTrans, 
00129                     float &pmIntensity, float &bgrdAdjust);
00130 
00131   /** 
00132    * @brief Default Getter method for parameters and their documentation.
00133    * @return map of parameters and their descriptions.
00134    */
00135   static std::vector<SelfDoc::Opt> getDefaultDocOptions() { 
00136     std::vector<SelfDoc::Opt> opts;
00137     SelfDoc::Opt probeMd5 = {"subsetmd5", SelfDoc::Opt::String, "", "", "NA", "NA",
00138                              "Md5sum of the probe ids being used as background."};
00139     opts.push_back(probeMd5);
00140     return opts;
00141   }
00142 
00143   /** 
00144    * @brief Supply a little how/what/why about the algorithms this
00145    * class performs and what parameters it takes.
00146    * @return SelfDoc
00147    */
00148   static SelfDoc explainSelf() { 
00149     GcAdjust doc;
00150 
00151     return doc;
00152   }
00153 
00154 
00155   /** 
00156    * @brief This static function should be overridden by child classes
00157    * to return an object of the correct type initialized correctly
00158    * with the parameters in the string, string map. All objects
00159    * created this way should be deleted when finished using.
00160    * 
00161    * @param param - Map of key/value pairs to initialize the object.
00162    * 
00163    * @return Pointer toCreate object, this should be sub casted as necessary.
00164    */
00165   static SelfCreate *newObject(std::map<std::string,std::string> &param) {
00166     if(param.size() != 0) { Err::errAbort(ToStr("No parameters for ") + ToStr(GCADJUSTSTR)); }
00167     return new GcAdjust();
00168   }
00169   
00170 private:
00171 
00172   /// Maximum GC count probe seen.
00173   int m_MaxGc;
00174   /// Have we calculated our parameters yet?
00175   bool m_BinsFilled;
00176   /// GC count of each probe as indexed by position.
00177   std::vector<char> m_ProbeGcVec;
00178   /// Parameters learned (median of GC background probes).
00179   std::vector<vector<float> > m_Bins;
00180   /// Probe to be used for estimating background median
00181   std::vector<int> m_Probes;
00182   /// mdsum of probe ids
00183   std::string m_ProbeMd5Sum;
00184 };
